remarks: Define the rank function.  See ~ rankval , ~ rankval2 , ~ rankval3 , or ~ rankval4 its value.  The rank is a kind of "inverse" of the cumulative hierarchy of sets function ` R1 ` : given a set, it returns an ordinal number telling us the smallest layer of the hierarchy to which the set belongs.  Based on Definition 9.14 of [TakeutiZaring] p. 79.  Theorem ~ rankid illustrates the "inverse" concept.  Another nice theorem showing the relationship is ~ rankr1a .  (Contributed by NM, 11-Oct-2003.)
statement:
df-rank $p |- rank = ( x e. _V |-> |^| { y e. On | x e. ( R1 ` suc y ) } ) $.
$d x y $.
